subject: Law
title: Emissions Trading and Cap-and-Trade
description: A quick, practical guide to Emissions Trading and Cap-and-Trade.

hook.text: What if companies could buy and sell the right to pollute? It sounds wrongâ€”but it actually reduces emissions.

buildup.text: Cap-and-trade sets a total emissions cap, then lets companies trade allowances to pollute within that limit.

discovery.text: Companies that cut emissions below their cap can sell unused permits. Those that exceed must buy more.

twist.text: The US acid rain program cut sulfur dioxide by 90% using cap-and-tradeâ€”far cheaper than direct regulation.

climax.text: The EU Emissions Trading System is the world's largest carbon market, covering over 10,000 installations.

punchline.text: Markets can serve the environment. The cap makes the difference.

quiz.question: How does cap-and-trade reduce pollution?
options: By setting a total cap and letting companies trade permits
